creator: Mackay, John Alexander, 1838-1923. (compiler and translator)
description: Mackay, John Alexander: 1838-1923. Native of Moosonee, Ontario; trained under Bishop Horden; ordained in the Church of England, 1862; at York Factory, 1862-1864, Stanley, 1864-1876, Nepowewin and Carlton, 1876-1877, and Battleford, 1877-1879; Cree tutor at Emmanuel College, Prince Albert, 1880-1884; in charge of Indian reserves at Battleford, 1885-1887; professor of divinity at Emmanuel, 1887-1900; superintendent of missions in diocese of Saskatchewan, 1900-1921; reorganized day school at Little Pine reserve, 1922; translator of religious works into Cree (Hopkins, Canadian annual review, 1923). // Title in Cree syllabics and in English. On cover: "Cree family prayers." Also published, Toronto: General Board of Religious Education of the Church of England in Canada, [1957] (32p.); revised by John Thomas Griffin, as Tahto-kisikaw-ayamihawina / Family prayers: Compiled and translated into the syllabic character of the Cree Language (Moosonee) , London: Society for Promoting Christian Knowledge, 1924, 1926 & 1949 (36p.).
subject: Native Languages--Devotional Literature
Indians of North America--Languages
Langues indiennes d'Amérique--Amérique du Nord
Liturgies
Actions liturgiques
title: Family prayers for the use of the Cree Indians: Compiled and translated into the syllabic characters of the Cree language
